sections.heading: What are けど and けれど?
sections.content:
けど and けれど both mean "but," "although," or "however," connecting clauses to show contrast. けど is casual and conversational, while けれど is slightly more formal. They're very common in everyday speech and more natural than が in casual contexts.

忙しいけど、行く。 "I'm busy, but I'll go." 高いけれど、買います。 "It's expensive, but I'll buy it."

children.heading: [Clause 1] + けど/けれど + [Clause 2]
children.content: 疲れたけど、頑張る。 "I'm tired, but I'll try hard." Within single sentence Casual connector

children.heading: Showing contrast
children.content: 難しいけど、面白い。 "It's difficult, but interesting." 好きじゃないけど、食べる。 "I don't like it, but I'll eat it." Opposing facts

children.heading: Softening statements
children.content: ちょっと聞きたいんだけど... "I want to ask you something, but..." 悪いんだけど... "I feel bad, but..." Cushioning requests

sections.heading: けど vs けれど vs けれども

children.heading: けど = most casual
children.content: 忙しいけど、行く。 "I'm busy, but I'll go." Everyday speech Very common

children.heading: けれど = slightly formal
children.content: 忙しいけれど、行きます。 "I'm busy, but I'll go." Polite conversation

children.heading: けれども = most formal
children.content: 忙しいけれども、参ります。 "I'm busy, but I'll go." Formal speech/writing Less common

children.heading: Mid-sentence connector
children.content: 雨だけど、出かける。 "It's raining, but I'll go out." Connects two clauses

children.heading: Can end sentence
children.content: A: 行く？ B: 行きたいんだけど... A: "Will you go?" B: "I want to go, but..." (implied hesitation) Trailing off

children.heading: With です/ます
children.content: 高いですけど、買います。 "It's expensive, but I'll buy it." 分かりますけど、できません。 "I understand, but I can't do it." Polite endings

children.heading: Making requests
children.content: 悪いんだけど、手伝ってくれる？ "I feel bad, but can you help me?" ちょっといいけど？ "Got a minute, but...?" (Can I talk to you?) Softening asks

children.heading: Giving opinions
children.content: いいと思うけど、ちょっと高いね。 "I think it's good, but it's a bit expensive." Qualified statements

children.heading: Casual refusals
children.content: 行きたいけど、無理だ。 "I want to go, but I can't." ごめん、今日はちょっと...けど。 "Sorry, today is a bit... but." Soft declining

children.heading: ん + だけど (explanatory)
children.content: 聞きたいんだけど... "I want to ask, but..." 行くんだけど、一緒にどう？ "I'm going, but want to come?" Explanatory + but Very conversational

children.heading: Implying continuation
children.content: 美味しいけど...（高い） "It's delicious, but..." (it's expensive - implied) 行きたいけど...（時間がない） "I want to go, but..." (I don't have time - implied) Leaving unsaid

children.heading: けど = within sentence
children.content: 疲れたけど、頑張る。 "I'm tired, but I'll try." Single sentence

children.heading: でも = between sentences
children.content: 疲れた。でも頑張る。 "I'm tired. But I'll try." Separate sentences

children.heading: けど = casual
children.content: 忙しいけど、行く。 "I'm busy, but I'll go." Conversational Natural in speech

children.heading: が = formal
children.content: 忙しいですが、行きます。 "I'm busy, but I'll go." More polite Formal situations

children.heading: With ない
children.content: 好きじゃないけど、食べる。 "I don't like it, but I'll eat it." 行きたくないけど、行く。 "I don't want to go, but I'll go." Negative contrasts

children.heading: Opening with けど
children.content: あのさ、ちょっと聞きたいんだけど... "Hey, I want to ask something, but..." ねえ、悪いんだけど... "Hey, I feel bad, but..." Conversation starter

children.heading: Sequential けど
children.content: 高いけど、美味しいけど、遠い。 Possible but awkward Better: 高くて美味しいけど、遠い。 "It's expensive and delicious, but far." Combine where possible

children.heading: Using けど too formally
children.content: Stiff: 謹んでお願いしますけど... ⚠️ Better: 謹んでお願いしますが... ✓ "I humbly request, but..." が better for very formal

children.heading: Ending abruptly
children.content: Incomplete: 行きたいけど ⚠️ Better: 行きたいんだけど... ✓ Or complete: 行きたいけど、無理 ✓ Need context or continuation

children.heading: Making statements gentler
children.content: Direct: これ、まずい Softer: 美味しいけど、ちょっと... "It's delicious, but a bit..." (not to my taste) Polite hedging

children.heading: Softening questions
children.content: 今、いい？ → 今、いいけど？ "Is now good?" → "Is now good?" (softer) Less direct

sections.heading: Expressing Uncertainty
sections.content: 分かるけど、できるかな... "I understand, but I wonder if I can do it..." Self-doubt

children.heading: Standard forms
children.content: けど (most common) けれど (slightly formal) けども (dialectal/emphatic) Regional differences exist

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 疲れたけど、頑張る。 "I'm tired, but I'll try hard." 高いけど、買う。 "It's expensive, but I'll buy it." 雨だけど、行く。 "It's raining, but I'll go." 好きじゃないけど、食べる。 "I don't like it, but I'll eat it." 悪いんだけど、手伝ってくれる？ "I feel bad, but can you help me?"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 日本語は難しいけど、毎日勉強すれば 必ず上達する。諦めないことが 一番大切だと思う。 "Japanese is difficult, but if you study every day, you'll definitely improve. I think not giving up is most important." このレストランは少し高いけど、 料理が美味しくて雰囲気もいい。 特別な日にぴったりだと思う。 "This restaurant is a bit expensive, but the food is delicious and the atmosphere is good. I think it's perfect for special occasions." 明日は休みだけど、やらなきゃいけない ことがたくさんある。のんびりしたい けど、無理そうだ。 "Tomorrow is a day off, but I have a lot of things I must do. I want to relax, but it seems impossible."
